newsitem.title: USA: Diametrics cutting U.S. staff by 10 pct.
newsitem.headline: Diametrics cutting U.S. staff by 10 pct.

text.p: Diametrics Medical Inc said Tuesday it had initiated a 10 percent staff reduction in its U.S. operations here.
Diametrics, a critical care technology company, said it would continue to take actions to meet its objectives for profitability in the third quarter of 1998.

"The recently announced acquisition of Pfizer's Biomedical Sensors business and today's announcement of additional staff reductions are consistent with the company's goal to be the world leader in critical care blood analysis systems," David Giddings, chairman, said in a statement.
Last week Diametrics completed the purchase of Biomedical Sensors from Pfizer Inc for $1.5 million cash and a $7.3 million six-year promissory note.
On Tuesday Diametrics named Roy Johnson, president of Biomedical Sensors, as executive vice president of Diametrics and a member of the board.
Also, Larry Betterley, chief financial officer, was named to the additional post of senior vice president-finance.
